Developer Reference¶

Below are the API references for the core modules.

Main application file for the Task List App. Handles the Kivy UI and integrates logic and database layers.

class main.TaskItem(task_id, text, **kwargs)¶

Bases: BoxLayout

Custom widget representing a task item.

class main.ToDoApp(**kwargs)¶

Bases: App

build()¶

Initializes the application; it will be called only once. If this method returns a widget (tree), it will be used as the root widget and added to the window.

Returns:

None or a root Widget instance if no self.root exists.

class main.ToDoScreen(**kwargs)¶

Bases: Screen

add_task()¶

Add a new task to the database and UI.

delete_task(task)¶

Delete a task from the database and UI.

load_tasks()¶

Load tasks from the database and display them in the UI.

on_stop()¶

Close the task manager when the app stops.

open_popup(task)¶

Open the update popup for a specific task.

update_task(task, new_text)¶

Update a task in both the database and UI.

Contains the core business logic for managing tasks in the Task List App.

class logic_layer.TaskManager(db_config)¶

Bases: object

add_task(task_text)¶

Add a new task to the database.

close()¶

Close the database connection.

delete_task(task_id)¶

Delete a task from the database.

load_tasks()¶

Load tasks from the database.

update_task(task_text, task_id)¶

Update an existing task in the database.

Handles all database interactions for the Task List App, including CRUD operations.

class db_layer.Database(host, user, password, database)¶

Bases: object

add_task(task_text)¶

Insert a new task into the database.

close()¶

Close the database connection.

create_table()¶

Create the tasks table if it doesn’t exist.

delete_task(task_id)¶

Delete a task from the database.

fetch_all_tasks()¶

Retrieve all tasks from the database.

update_task(task_text, task_id)¶

Update a task in the database.
